programmes.show_description: Tunnel of Terrors: Exploring a military strong-hold in the Philippines, a facility that spawned an American sporting great, and an English relic that hosted a cinematic sensation.
Apocalyptic Skyscraper: Exploring a ruined castle above a German village, a rural town in Idaho, a futuristic skyscraper in Johannesburg and a fantasy world outside of Buenos Aires.
General Motors: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.
Shopping from Home.
Montreal to Ottawa: In Montreal, Michael Portillo learns how French and British colonial roots have influenced the city. In Ottawa, the former politician visits the country's parliament.
Thousand Islands to Toronto: Michael Portillo takes to the water for a nautical journey through the Thousand Islands, before his railway journey across Canada concludes in Toronto.
Ford Granada/Toyota Hilux: Derek navigates the dry stone walls of the Peak District to collect a very original 1988 Opel Manta. Plus, Dave deals with a Ford Granada rally support vehicle.
Bedford Bus/Triumph TR7: Derek has a three-hour drive in a 1960s bus that arrived in the UK after a life in the sun. Dave takes a Triumph TR7 convertible to auction.
US Aviation: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.
Total War: Learn more about the 'war to end all wars' through illuminating and often shocking statistics. After 1916, the imperial powers redoubled their efforts to win the war.
Cardiff Castle 1: Fiona Bruce presents from Cardiff Castle, where items brought in to be valued include a jug given as a love token, an early Hockney print, and a signed Elgar score.
Minehead Railway Station 2: Fiona Bruce presents from Minehead Railway Station, where items brought in include a chair thought to have once belonged to Henry VIII.
Rolls Royce/Impreza/Jag/Fords: There's Hollywood glamour in the air as Derek heads out to pick up a Rolls Royce that once belonged to Fred Astaire.
Healey/Porsche Soapbox: Austin Healeys are classic British vehicles that are difficult to tame. Paul and Charlie have the rare chance to pick up a trio of these iconic cars in varying conditions. S10
US Aviation: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.
Total War: Learn more about the 'war to end all wars' through illuminating and often shocking statistics. After 1916, the imperial powers redoubled their efforts to win the war.
Cardiff Castle 1: Fiona Bruce presents from Cardiff Castle, where items brought in to be valued include a jug given as a love token, an early Hockney print, and a signed Elgar score.
Simon begins his journey in the south of Ireland by paramotoring with an Irish explorer before doing a spot of surfing and climbing Croagh Patrick in honour of Ireland's patron saint.
Daimler / Triumph 2000: Derek points the team towards one of his favourite motors - a 1983 Daimler Double Six. And a Triumph 2000 is given a modern day makeover under the bonnet.
Porsche 911: Irv imports an original-run short wheelbase Porsche 911 from the east coast of America. He needs to make it roadworthy, while keeping its incredible sun-faded patina.
Rolls Royce/Impreza/Jag/Fords: There's Hollywood glamour in the air as Derek heads out to pick up a Rolls Royce that once belonged to Fred Astaire.
Healey/Porsche Soapbox: Austin Healeys are classic British vehicles that are difficult to tame. Paul and Charlie have the rare chance to pick up a trio of these iconic cars in varying conditions. S10
Ruins of Empire: Exploring a British fort that became a bizarre zoo, a brutalist school for Communist top brass and a lost world hides secrets of a vanished people.
Trouble in Paradise: Exploring a luxury resort in Argentina, a Greek palace above a Mexican city and a former hotel in Hawaii.
US Aviation: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.
Shopping from Home.
Ninilchik to Wasilla: Michael Portillo begins a journey across Alaska, learning its links with Russia, feeding a sea otter pup and joining the US Arctic Warriors for parachute training.
Talkeetna to Juneau: Michael Portillo continues to explore Alaska, helping a homesteader fell a tree to clear land for a log cabin and meeting scientists studying the Northern Lights.
Vanden Plas/Ford Fiesta XR2: Dave's on his way to Grimsby to pick up an iconic 80s fast Ford, the Mk1 Fiesta XR2.
Alvis 12/50/Alfetta/RS2000: Derek gets a tour of Hadlow Castle in Kent when he arrives to collect the owner's pre-war Alvis and an immaculate Citroen used by the Gestapo in occupied France.
Occupied Territories: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated with the Resistance to hinder the Nazis' use of military vehicles.
Endgame: Hear how the arrival of American forces and an Allied counter-offensive in 1918 helped defeat Germany. Tragically, 11,000 men were killed or injured on Armistice Day.
Cardiff Castle 2: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Cardiff Castle where items include an elaborately decorated Indian flask and a rare piece of porcelain.
Stormont Parliament Buildings and Estate 1: Fiona Bruce presents from the Stormont Parliament Building in Belfast, where items to be valued include diving gear from the Titanic.
Buses/Ladyline/Norton Jubilee: Derek's got his work cut out collecting a huge haul that includes two Bentleys, a Daimler and a traditional Bowtop caravan.
Merc/Unicycle/Sinclair C5/Golf/AWO: Dave has to extricate a VW Golf from a garden that has grown up around it.
Occupied Territories: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated with the Resistance to hinder the Nazis' use of military vehicles.
Endgame: Hear how the arrival of American forces and an Allied counter-offensive in 1918 helped defeat Germany. Tragically, 11,000 men were killed or injured on Armistice Day.
Cardiff Castle 2: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Cardiff Castle where items include an elaborately decorated Indian flask and a rare piece of porcelain.
Starting at the Giant's Causeway, Simon travels down the east coast to the rapidly changing cities of Belfast and Dublin before ending his tour in the Wicklow Mountains.

MG Magnette/Morris Minor/De Tomaso Longchamp/Ford Escort Rally Car: Derek collects a pair of stylish British classics from a Yorkshire workshop, with the Morris 1000 finding a new home with a 10-year-
Hot on the trail of a lost fortune in gold, Andrew and Jeff find a hidden location where legendary explorer Lasseter may have camped.

Merc/Unicycle/Sinclair C5/Golf/AWO: Dave has to extricate a VW Golf from a garden that has grown up around it.
